sections.name: Fractions Mastery in UAE Context
sections.math_objective: Students will add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators, convert between improper fractions and mixed numbers, and apply fraction operations to real-world UAE contexts (e.g., sharing recipes, organizing time, and distributing items).

materials: Fraction bars or visual fraction pieces

success_criteria.metric: Accuracy on guided addition/subtraction of fractions with unlike denominators (out of 10)
Conversion of improper fractions to mixed numbers (percent correct)
Correct solutions and justification for UAE-context word problems (out of 5)
Group collaboration and communication quality (5-point rubric average)

teacher.objective: Facilitate a 40-minute Fractions Mastery lesson, ensuring students can perform addition/subtraction with unlike denominators, convert improper fractions to mixed numbers, and apply these skills to UAE-context problems; assess reasoning through reasoning oracy and written work.
steps: Step 1: Introduce visual fraction bars to model common denominators and illustrate addition/subtraction with unlike denominators; check understanding with quick oral checks.
Step 2: Guide students through practice using fraction cards to add/subtract fractions; circulate to monitor strategies and identify misconceptions.
Step 3: Teach converting improper fractions to mixed numbers; model with visuals and provide guided practice.
Step 4: Present UAE-context word problems and facilitate group discussion; collect student explanations to assess reasoning.

shared.objective: In groups, students plan, solve, and justify a set of fraction problems, including UAE-context word problems; communicate strategies clearly and respectfully.
steps: Step 1: Assign roles within the group (facilitator, recorder, presenter) and skim problems to plan approach.
Step 2: Solve problems collaboratively using visuals and written explanations; agree on final solutions and prepare to present.

1.objective: Student 1 will accurately perform addition and subtraction of fractions with unlike denominators using visual aids, identify equivalent fractions, and verify results.
steps: Step 1: Use fraction bars to find common denominators and set up addition/subtraction.
Step 2: Compute sums/differences, simplify, and estimate to check reasonableness.

2.objective: Student 2 will convert improper fractions to mixed numbers and solve a UAE-context word problem involving fractions, articulating reasoning to the group.
steps: Step 1: Convert a set of improper fractions to mixed numbers using visuals.
Step 2: Read, interpret, and solve a UAE-context word problem; explain the reasoning orally and in writing.
